title: 加州橡树岭高中社会学实验课堂

action: Sit quietly at desk, observe classroom and teacher for instructions
thoughts: First day of this sociology experiment. I should follow all the rules carefully and make a good impression. The teacher seems strict but I want to be cooperative and earn good standing in the class.
memory: Prepared to follow all rules carefully

action: Maintains proper posture while discreetly observing teacher's movements and classmates' reactions
thoughts: The teacher seems to be evaluating everyone's behavior. I need to demonstrate perfect compliance while also noticing who might be struggling with the rules. Social acceptance here depends on following authority properly.

action: Maintains proper posture while subtly observing teacher's clipboard notations
thoughts: The teacher is making notes on the clipboard - probably recording our discipline scores. I need to maintain perfect compliance to avoid losing points. I wonder what criteria they're using for evaluation.
memory: Noticed teacher documenting behavior on clipboard
Maintained perfect compliance posture during observation
Focused on avoiding discipline point deductions

action: Maintains proper posture while discreetly observing peer reactions to teacher's clipboard notations
thoughts: The teacher is clearly documenting our behavior. I need to maintain perfect compliance while also understanding how others are being evaluated. Social acceptance means knowing what the group is doing right and wrong.
memory: Observing peer reactions to teacher's evaluation patterns
Noting variations in compliance among classmates
Maintaining perfect posture to avoid point deductions
